boardgame.name: Rapture
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a Cepheus Engine Adventure.

The travelers are approached by two concerned parents. Their daughter, Jenna, has fallen into the clutches of a strange religious cult known as the Triumphant Lodge of the Rapture. These cultists live together on a base on an asteroid and allow no visitors. They seem peaceful enough but they do not permit contact with relatives. They want their daughter rescued and brought back home safely.

boardgame.name: Agents of EaGLE
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Although no one holds an exact count, approximately 0.001% of the world’s population possesses some form of special power or ability. This places the number of super-powered beings (SPBs) at over 7,000 worldwide. These individuals range in power levels from minor to literally earth-shaking, with most people falling somewhere in the lower half of the scale. While some people acquired special powers through an accident of genetics, many more gained their abilities thanks to genetic manipulation—in some cases before they were even born or for reasons as yet unknown. While no method for creating super-powered individuals has proven foolproof or guaranteed, the science involved continues to advance at a startling pace.

The first recorded instance of a human possessing superhuman powers occurred shortly after the Second Great War. Within a year, another thirteen such individuals came to light. Governments, militaries, and intelligence agencies around the world scrambled to find out everything they could about these people. Everyone sought answers to the same questions, most notably how did these individuals acquire their powers, and was the process reproducible?
boardgame.rpgseries: Official Handbook of the Amazing Universe

boardgame.name: The Concrete Maelstrom (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A laboratory building is the target of sabotage and espionage during an extended period of unrest in the city. The PCs, employed by the lab as extra security during the citywide unrest, are tasked with helping with the defense of the building and are central to stopping the plot.

The Concrete Maelstrom is a short cyberpunk adventure designed for a group of beginning characters and intended to be the pilot for a new campaign. The adventure includes a map, NPC stats, and suggestions for further adventures.

This version is compatible with New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America, which uses the Cepheus Engine (CE), Cepheus Deluxe (CD), and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) rules.
boardgame.rpgsetting: New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America

boardgame.name: Hazard: Tornado!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A tornado is a violently rotating column of air that extends from a thundercloud to the ground. Also called twisters, whirlwinds, or cyclones, a tornado is the most violent and unpredictable atmospheric disturbance. They’re also among the most recognizable

A tornado is also a dangerous, implacable, invincible foe that makes even the doughtiest adventurer quake in terror. Guns are useless against it, reason can’t sway it, and even the mightiest of starships is forced to flee from its horrific power.

Hazard: Tornado! allows the Referee to bring this awesome force of nature into the campaign. This short file is packed with a (vastly simplified) discussion of how tornadoes form, their characteristics, game stats, and what happens to those who dare stand against one.

Hazard: Tornado! By the time you see it, it’s already too late.

boardgame.name: Matrix Nova
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Stedet er Berlin, år 2025. Matrix Nova er en gruppe deckere (kyberdeck-hackere), der lever af foretagsomhed m.h.t. at bryde ind i computeranlæg og stjæle oplysninger til den tyske undergrund eller penge til sig selv.

Som alle andre deckers opererer Matrix Nova-folkene under dæknavne. De er: Rote Licht, Ernan, Dr. Sturm, Pink Punk, Gemini, Tolle Stern og Blume.

En aften ringer Rote Licht og fortæller, at han har fundet noget spændende på Nettet...

boardgame.name: Helios
boardgame.description:
FORTUNE FAVOURS THE BOLD
A card game for the brave, to be played with friends. The aim of the game is to win by earning coins or stealing them from your opponent. Guess the suit or the god behind the cards to get more powers to use against your opponents. You can change the game by making the right choice at the right time. Place your bets...

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Thaumistry: In Charm's Way
boardgame.description:
Eric Knight was a child prodigy who was featured on the cover of Invent! Magazine at the age of 13 for his invention of an anti-stain chemical treatment.

Unfortunately, he hasn’t invented anything since and now, at the age of 23, he has a strong case of imposter syndrome. He feels like a failure.

For the past few years he has been given laboratory space in a start-up incubator, but as the game opens, he is holding a letter from IncuLab threatening to pull the plug if he cannot demonstrate within a day that his latest invention works.

As he thinks this over, an energetic stranger bursts into his lab and says, “I’m your wake-up call, dude. You feel like you don't quite fit in, right? Weird things happen when you're around? Traffic lights turn red just as you get to them. Elevator doors don't close when you push the button. Your alarm clock randomly fails in the morning. There's a name for people like that. We're called Bodgers. I'm one, and you might be one too.”

Eric soon learns that Bodgers are a group of people through whom magic flows into the world. Some Bodgers aren’t aware of this ability, and they come to regard themselves as accident-prone, jinxes, or jonahs. But Bodgers who realize their identity can learn to channel this mischievous magic. The aim of a Bodger is to make a small thing go wrong in order to make big things go right.

Is Eric himself a Bodger? Through the course of the game he tries to find out. But first there is an imminent danger that must be dealt with. Another inventor has created a thaumeter – a device that measures magical energy. Its unveiling is planned for the end of day, and if that happens then the existence of the Bodgers will be exposed, and mass persecution will follow.

boardgame.name: Erebor Nyhedsbrev (Issue 8 - Aug 1987)
boardgame.description:
Erebor Nyhedsbrev
Nr. 8 - August 1987

boardgame.name: Erebor Nyhedsbrev (Issue 68 - 1995)
boardgame.description:
Erebor Nyhedsbrev
Nyhedsbrev'et Nr. 68

boardgame.name: Nichevo
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

2008.06.12

En grupp Bio-agenter skickas från Bastion, SPN’s Bio-armourskepp, till ryska Murmansk. Rapporter om rörelse ute i båtvraken har nått SPN och ert team är de snabbast mobiliserade på Bastion för tillfället. Vilna kör teamet i en jet, och det är på det skeppet som spelet börjar.

Landar först i Murmansk, får där en närmare briefing. Vilna översätter ryskan åt agenterna, förmedlar lokalbefolkningens iaktagelser sedan rapporten kom in.

boardgame.name: SuperAce Tennis
boardgame.description:
SuperAce Tennis is the perfect simulation of real tennis on your table. Instead of a tennis ball, jumping fleas, instead of athletes figurines. To do this, a court with a surface specially developed for this game. Play singles or doubles, organize an exciting tournament with family and friends. The game includes a mobile application that will make it easier for you to calculate the score.

Attack with precise blows or patiently wait for the opponent's mistake. Play, train, improve, win.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Totenstadt: Vier Pfoten Booster
boardgame.description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

Explore the dog school, fight mutants and zombie dogs or find a friend for life!

The cards can simply be mixed up with the Totenstadt basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!

Erkundet die Hundeschule, bekämpft Mutanten und Zombie Hunde oder findet einen Freund fürs Leben!

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Totenstadt: Hausverbot Booster
boardgame.description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

Explore the night clubs of the Totenstadt, fight with bouncers and find out what gold is hidden in the safe!

The cards can simply be mixed up with the Totenstadt basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!

Erkundet die Nachtclubs der Totenstadt, schlagt euch mit Türstehern rum und findet raus was sich goldenes im Tresor versteckt!

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Totenstadt: Frischfleisch Booster
boardgame.description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

Defend yourselves against Eddie and his cannibals.
Save your victims from being slaughtered as a main course and grab a fancy meat cleaver!

The cards can simply be mixed up with the Totenstadt basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!

Verteidigt euch gegen Eddie uns seine Kannibalen.
Rettet ihre Opfer davor als Hauptspeise auf der Schlachtbank zu laden und schnappt euch ein schickes Fleicherbeil!

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Totenstadt: Zeit des Horters Booster
boardgame.description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

It's Christmas in the Totenstadt and the Hoarder is on the way!
Take care of your equipment and prevent thieving elves from getting their hands on it.
Then there is Robert the reindeer ...

The cards can simply be mixed up with the Totenstadt basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!

Es ist Weihnachten in der Totenstadt und der Horter ist unterwegs!
Passt auf eure Ausrüstung auf und verhindert das diebische Elfen sie in ihre Hände bekommen.
Dann ist da noch Robert das Renntier ...

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Viscounts of the West Kingdom: Crossover Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
This mini expansion is included inside the Viscounts Collector's Box. It will also be made available for individual purchase.

Consists of 12 promo items: 4 Outsiders, 4 Hero Townsfolk, and 4 Chest Tiles. All of these items require both Gates of Gold and Keeper of Keys to function, as they tie together elements from both expansions.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Viscounts of the West Kingdom: Collector's Box
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Viscounts of the West Kingdom: Gates of Gold
Viscounts of the West Kingdom: Keeper of Keys

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: My Monsters
boardgame.description:
Once upon a time, there was ... a monster! Well, many monsters to be exact, in different colours, with spots, scales, fur... Monsters of every kind!

A game of observation and speed for the whole family. Find the monster parts shown on the dice and build the maximum number of monsters.

A very funny game that, in addition to:

stimulates visual perception
practices mental agility
requires players to make logical deductions


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fairview - Civilian Defence Guidebook
boardgame.description:
In 1945 the world stopped changing.

And for the people of Fairview, the war continues on. Isolated and removed from the rest of the United States, the inhabitants of fairview go about their daily lives supporting the town and the war effort. In Fairview, the citizens work for the greater good.

Long live the President!

Long live America!

Fairview is a roleplaying about a small community in Anytown, USA during a World War II that never ended. Players take on the roles of characters living in one of these small communities, trying to support the war effort by growing food, producing ammunitions, or recycling rubber. Everyone is an invested member of their community. But there's something unsettling about Fairview… something beneath the surface suggests something is not quite right.

boardgame.name: Legends of Avallen
boardgame.description:
“From that island at the end of the world, no soldier returned without tales of wonder. Walking forests, talking fae, enigmatic shapes half man and half beast; things that you ought not to believe unless you see them yourself.” —Kaato the Sage on the invasion of Avallen

Inspired by Celtic mythology in Roman Britain, Legends of Avallen is a roleplaying game that takes you to a mystical island occupied by faithless invaders. For now, peace has been called but it balances on a sword’s edge as all seek to tame the Otherworld—a parallel realm home to fae, demons, dragons, and gods.

On Avallen, the greatest legends rise from humble beginnings, and yours will be no different. The shepherd ordained as a Druid, the bard reborn as a Fae Touched, the thief who found glory as a Gladiator. What tales will be told of you? Will you mend the rifts between worlds, or delve into their depths for fame, fortune, and power?

Features:

Quick character creation with deep character growth. Witness your humble townsperson rise into legend with 40 profession, martial, magic, and legendary ability schools.
Engaging mechanics that reward ingenuity. Setup allies in combat, uncover motivations in parleys, craft gear from slain monsters, and navigate risks on epic journeys.
An original ruleset that needs just a deck of regular playing cards. Get creative with your surroundings and work together with your friends to earn more cards for checks.
Extensive guides, tools, world lore, and a bestiary full of Celtic creatures to help Gamemasters craft their own unique quests.

Includes “Quest for the Sealing Stone”, an introductory adventure that teaches your aspiring heroes the game rules as you play.

boardgame.name: Chameleon
boardgame.description:
A solid wood game for two persons. Every player tries to collect 6 tiles in different colors (red, blue, green, yellow, purple and light green).

The rules are simple. Roll the (normal) dice and rotate the big wooden dice around one of it's edges on the board so many times. If it stops above a tile with the same color as the dice shows take it. Please note that no player can cross a tile more than two times or select tiles of the same color more than once. Who first owns all six different tiles wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Savage Worlds Super Powers Companion (3rd Edition)
Savage Worlds Super Powers Companion (SWADE)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Few mediums inspire today’s gamers like comic books, graphic novels, and the movies and television shows based on them. The Savage Worlds Super Powers Companion lets you recreate everything from classic Marvel® and DC® tales to modern takes like The Boys®, Kick-Ass®, or Invincible®… all in the award-winning Savage Worlds rules system!

This 200-page PDF updates the original Super Powers Companion to be completely compatible with Savage Worlds Adventure Edition.

boardgame.name: Die Olchis: Das Spiel zum Film
boardgame.description:
A muffle fart cool memo game:

Cheesy stinker sock, it smells quite rotten in Schmuddelfing! The Olchis have until 12 noon to free the small town from the bad smell. Then begins the citizens' meeting, at which the future of the dirty finger dump, the home of the Olchis, is decided.

Go together with the Olchi children in search of fine herringbones, toady slippers and crisp batteries. You have to roll in order and reveal cards. As soon as three cards of the same waste are revealed it is automatically selected. But be careful not to accidentally get a voucher for the wellness hotel. Because then it's time to Yikes, off to the bathtub, take a bubble bath, and that costs valuable time!

The game starts with an area of 4 times 6 hidden tiles with the player token in one corner and the vouchers in the others.

Roll a dice and either increase the time if the dice shows a clock or move depending on the result 1-3 fields with a single player token. Ensure that the final field is revealed and add a chip on all three tiles with player tokens if they are equal. For the next turn hide the tiles without chip again if you leave it and the next player tries again.

You win the game if the clock shows less than 12 o‘clock and there are chips on all waste tiles otherwise you loose.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Creatures: Die Olchis (designed by Erhard Dietl)

boardgame.name: Dice Cards
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Play without Dice!

For each shuffle of the deck, you can do one of the following:


15d4
10d6
7d8
6d10
5d12
3d20

boardgame.name: Murder in Thay
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

With the rise of Tiamat threatening to destroy the world, the undead masters of Thay have approached the Council of Waterdeep to discuss the possibility of an alliance. But the Dragon Queen has agents everywhere, even in a remote keep on the Thayan frontier. A vampire noblewoman has been killed, and the characters are the prime suspects. To clear their names, they must find the real killer, and learn how even the undead may die…

For characters of levels 13-14

boardgame.name: Hike!: Events and Traits Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
If you like Hike! and wish to have an even bigger experience, the Events and Traits expansion is for you. It adds a hefty deck of 64 cards to the gameplay. It includes trait cards that players get at the beginning of the game and that give them a bit of asymmetric starting positions, and event cards that add another layer to card drafting, and present players with more options in the race phase. Event cards are divided into two groups - the majority of them are events that only influence the race track or the player that played them, and there are 12 event cards that include more player interaction and a bit of 'take that' element. Players can decide if they want these last 12 events part of the game or not. The cards include text in English.

-description from the Kickstarter campaign

boardgame.name: Iago
boardgame.description:
Iago is an abstract strategy game for two players. It is based on Othello, but starts with an empty board and has rules for forced capture, like checkers.

Enemy disks that are flipped over by being sandwiched by your disks become the third color, red, instead of your color. If the red disk wants to flip over again, one of your disks sandwiching it must be in the outer area or in the center space. Your final score is determined by multiplying the number of discs in the inner area by ones in the outer area.

Like Iago, who tricked Othello in Shakespeare's tragedy, you can use these rules to cunningly outsmart your opponent.

—description from the designer

listing.notes:
English rules included (if you need the Japanese rules, please contact us).
Sold by the publisher himself. Shipping cost from Japan will be charged. If you buy more than one item from me at the same time, you can save on shipping costs.

boardgame.name: Blue Coats: Black Flags
boardgame.description:
This is an asymmetrical board game for 2-4 players set in the age of sail. The initial release comes with 4 playable factions: British, Spanish, Merchants (West Indies Trading Company), and Pirates. The goal is to be the first player to secure 10VP. Pirates can score VP by sacking ports, boarding ships, producing and selling rum, establishing pirate havens, etc. The British can earn VP by escorting colony or merchant ships through safe passage, setting up colonies, declaring war on Spain, etc. The merchant player works to build trading posts and plantations to export goods back to Europe. The Spanish are trying hard to keep out the British and others, keep their hold on the goods and export their gold back to Spain.

The game utilizes customizable card decks for unique strategy and player preference gaming; tokens for ship movement, plantation and colony locations; and RPG for in-game outcomes.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Strange and Delightful Emporium: A First Time DM Adventure
boardgame.description:
"Do you love Dungeons & Dragons and want to become a Dungeon Master yourself? Do you have new players you want to give a taste of D&D without overwhelming them? This adventure is for you!

The Strange and Delightful Emporium is a First Time DM Adventure. This means that the adventure includes encounters that introduce each of the three pillars of play: Social Interaction, Combat, and Exploration, with clear and detailed guidance for Dungeon Masters on how to prep and run each section.

This is a 2-3 hour adventure designed for 1-5 first level characters.

Visit the Greenbottle Emporium Today!"

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Time to Mate
boardgame.description:
A strategic board game about biology of mating and competition. In Time to Mate, players race against each other in a bid to spread their genes around the island. Players must be strategic in building the Reproduction and Survival traits of their male and female Mates to gain the most DNA points through mating and cooperation with other players.

Improve your Mate's traits to become the most attractive lover or the deadliest fighter. Deceive and betray other players, form alliances, survive catastrophic season events, and even inbreed (if you dare...).

Every game is a new adventure with Time to Mate, so there is never a dull moment on this island. New players bring on new tactics, new rounds bring on new seasons and their unpredictability.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Heckonomics
boardgame.description:
The objective of players is to gain as much money as possible by the end of the game. During the game players roll the dice and choose where to travel to within the limitations of their roll. After landing they can take an applicable action. This mostly involves investment in companies or political actions. Players are able to influence the population of the city in order to gain votes. This allows them to make political decisions that can impact the financial situation in the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Basketball Legends
boardgame.description:
A comprehensive basketball simulation with the capability of playing high school, college, and professional basketball teams based on their real stats.

After the initial setup, which adjusts a team's ratings in various offensive and defensive statistical categories, the play is resolved by rolling dice and consulting the appropriate chart on the applicable team.

Players can adjust the rolls by spending "Coaching Points" that affect the outcome of particular plays. This adds a strategic gameplay element to a genre of games that is often very dice-driven.

Example: Team A may be very good at offensive rebounds. When a shot is missed, they would have a better chance of grabbing a rebound than teams without as good ratings. By spending coaching points, those results can be modified. Doing so at key moments can have a huge effect on the game outcome.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Pog Surf'n Toss Game
boardgame.description: Toss your Pogs onto a teetering “seasaw,” while keeping them from sliding off. Use strategy to bounce off or slide under the central Pogman. Get rid of all your milkcaps first to win.

boardgame.name: マチナミトリテ (Machinamitorite)
boardgame.description:
This is a fashionable open terrace cafe.

Today, traveling is gathered with friends who have a hobby.
If you bring a nice picture of the cityscape you took while traveling and let the memories of each fun trip bloom ...

Suddenly, a gust of wind blew the photo away!

I picked it up in a hurry, but the photos fell apart, and I have no idea who took them or where.

Get more photos of the same cityscape than anyone else!

[Game Play]
Matinami Trite is a trick taking game. There are 4 suits (value 1~5) and one additional special trump (green) suit (value "A" or 0). Players have to follow the lead suit in a round. The game has a set of special designed cards with different terrace card back of a card. Players have to win tricks and collect cards of different terrace so that they can get high scores at game end.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Lauf und kauf Persil 59
boardgame.description: A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start in front of their respective tracks. The first to reach space 17 wins the game. On the numbered intersections of both tracks events hinder or benefit the players.

boardgame.name: Au Creux de ta Main: La vie de Mei
In the Palm of your Hand: Life of Mei
boardgame.description:
Expansion for the game In the Palm of your Hand: try to make your teammate guess the right card by miming it using the objects in the box in the palm of their hand as their eyes remain closed.
Discover beautiful illustrations showing the life of Mei, wife of the first hero of the game, Leon.

In this expansion, discover «The Life of Mei» from her childhood to the encounter with Leon. See the story of the core game through the eyes of this new character! Adds a nice replay value to the core game with 50 new cards and 2 new objects.

Mix the 50 cards of this expansion with the 100 cards of the core game. Add the 2 new objects to the ones from the core game. Play as usual and discover the life of the characters from another angle. Find new ways to mime the cards of the base game thanks to the new objects, as well as new ways to use the objects of the base game thanks to the 50 new cards. The cards also bring new possibilities to interfere with the memories!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: In the Palm of Your Hand

boardgame.name: Circuitry
boardgame.description:
Build the circuit board with the help of 30 double-sided cards. Move strategically your pawn from a CHARGE POINT to the MASTER NODE and collect and play the charge cards. You can change the circuit board's pathways, or force your opponents to move when they don’t want to. The goal: build and negotiate the pathways to reach your charge point, before returning to the master node and eliminate other players.

How to Play:
Take circuit-board card #1 and put it with the numbered side face-up between all the players. Each player chooses a coloured pawn and places it on the matching coloured NODE of card #1.

The CHARGE POINT circuit-board cards (#2-#7): each have a different coloured charge point.
Each player takes the CHARGE POINT card that corresponds to their pawn's colour and the rest of the CHARGE POINT cards are now put away and no longer used.
The remaining circuit-board cards (#8 - #30) are shuffled and each player is dealt an additional 3 so each player now has 4 circuit-board cards in hand (which includes their CHARGE POINT card). The rest is put away.

The gold-back mini cards (movement and certain action cards) are shuffled and placed in their own deck (face down). The green action mini cards are separated into their own corresponding piles (6 of them) and placed face up.

Turns:
Each turn a player selects 2 mini cards of any combination that they wish to take.
A player can have as many mini cards in hand as they wish, and may play any amount of mini cards in any order during their turn

Each turn a player may also play (but does not have to) a single circuit-board card at any point in their turn, any way up and in any orientation, as long as it connects to a corresponding edge of another card (i.e. longest edge to longest edge, etc - you get the gist).

listing.notes: Kickstarter version Played as couple of times, but still looks as new. No smoke or pet environment. Parts in plastic bags. So keep coming back. I try to keep prices as low as possible. So they are as cheap as they can get. Thanks for your interest!

boardgame.name: Cross
boardgame.description:
The goal of the players is to lay a continuous path from their own corner to the opposite corner on a square game board. To do this, they draw face-down tiles with single-lane and double-lane paths and lay out up to 3 tiles per turn.
The winner is determined by scoring over a previously agreed number of games.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Kite Bomber
boardgame.description:
A new monster card for Battle for Greyport.

The promo card comes from The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport: Store Event Kits – Season 2

Damage: Black die
Title: Kite Bomber
Hit Points: 6
Text Box: If you defeat Kite Bomber with Snipe damage, deal (black die) damage to a pirate ship or location monster
Threat: 1
Faction: Pirates
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Pirates!

boardgame.name: Tang Garden: Seasons
boardgame.description:
The roofs of the villages of the Tang Dynasty are the first to notice the slightest temperature changes and the passing of time. The wind blows, raising dry leaves that fly before the snow covers every architecture. After several days the air starts smelling like pollen and gets warmer, the flowers start blooming again, and the sun dries the mud into cracked earth once again.

Tang Garden: Seasons is the final expansion for Tang Garden. We have crafted different rich scenarios by getting inspiration from the mechanisms you most love in board games that will completely change the way you create your beautiful garden. In this expansion, you will find new tiles, decorations, panoramas, visitors, boards, and new components that you have never seen before.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 5MAL5
boardgame.description:
In this game inspired by a television format, players must attempt to guess 5 letter words similar to word mastermind. If the guesser manages to guess the word within 5 rounds, he may draw 2 chips, which he places on his bingo board. The guessing right changes to the opponent if the player fails to think of a guess word within a certain time, fails to find the correct word after 5 rounds or draws a red ball while drawing the chips. The first player to complete a bingo row wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Art Thief
boardgame.description:
Art Thief is a fast cooperative game for two players or solo play.

Each turn you draw and play a room card, then move your thief. If the card played has the same item on it as two other cards already in play, one of those cards gets flipped and is no longer accessible. Can you complete the heist before the guards close in on you both?

Art Thief comes with an easy mode for learning to play the game, a hard mode for master thieves, and some optional rules (below) for spicing up the gameplay.

A fast, strategic, cooperative game that fits in your pocket?

What a steal.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Skyline Express: Scoring tokens
boardgame.description: 4 screen printed wooden scoring tokens to replace the standard scoring discs. This add-on was available in the campaign pledge manager.

boardgame.name: Ghosts Love Candy Too: Dice Tower Promos
boardgame.description:
Set of four promo cards for the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

The pack includes four new kids that can be mixed into your deck of kids, each with new abilities not found on other cards:


Game Reviewer - Tell everyone your least favorite candy. You may then swap up to 3 of those candies from your stash for any treats in the neighborhood or discard pile.



Dice Tower - Discard a kid from the deck and look at its number. If it is 20 or lower, discard a candy. If it is 80 or higher take a treat from the discard.



Bowl of Cereal - The first player in turn order must haunt the Bowl of Cereal or place a treat on them.



Meeple - You may place a treat from your stash on any other kid in the neighborhood then use their ability if able.

boardgame.name: StarDrifter
boardgame.description:
StarDrifter is a solo, story dice game based in a science fiction setting.

StarDrifter is reminiscent of games like Barbarian Prince (1980), where every game is a unique story experience.

You are a talented pilot with a nebulous past. Your time spent away from your home-world has been mostly taken up with performing dishonourable jobs for untrustworthy characters. Your most recent run in with the authorities has caused you to question your life's current trajectory and has you feeling that maybe it is time for a course correction.
Equipped with your ray gun, multi-purpose utility pad and modest starship, you are ready to travel the cosmos in your hope for acclaim. The galaxy is vast, densely populated and full of odd planets, dangerous creatures and intergalactic anomalies. There are humans and aliens that live throughout, in peace and also at war. You simply want to make your mark among the stars.

Will you fall victim to one of the endless dangers found throughout the galaxy or will you find glory among the stars?

boardgame.name: King of Tokyo/King of New York: Meka Hunter & King Cron (promo characters)
boardgame.description: Set of 2 promo characters funded through Spieleschmiede, and generated to support Berlin Brettspiel Con during Corona Virus time.

listing.notes: Shipping worldwide: 6 Please read Seller info below.

boardgame.description:
Victims of an attack, the plans of an unprecedented technology have been stolen from the powerful Solax laboratories.
You play as a group of elite agents: an android, a martial arts expert, an alien and a mercenary. Your mission is to intercept the spy droid in the streets of Rome. Nobody dares to imagine the consequences if you fail...
Investigation, traps, fights, survival and puzzles await you. But will you be able to work together to succeed in your common hunt without being distracted by your individual secret objectives?
Play alone or with others, make the right choices of paths and actions and weave your own adventure because YOU are the heroes!"

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Glisse Banquise
Pengo Jump
boardgame.description:
Jump from one iceberg to another with your penguin friends to reach the ice floe.


Push an iceberg across the sea.
Cleverly move it to connect it to another iceberg.
Make a penguin jump on an iceberg.


Can you get all your friends to the ice floe in time?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Houbařův ráj
Wonder Woods
boardgame.description:
Fall is here, the woods have been watered by the rain and the mushrooms have sprouted! You and your green-fingered friends are ready to go to your favorite mushroom patches to pick girolles, morels, boletes and Parasol mushrooms! Be careful though, there are others who have found these secret mushroom patches!
Use your talent for mushroom picking to make sure you have the most delicious harvest!


Use your talent to identify the best mushroom patches in these woods,
Harvest Parasol mushrooms, boletes, girolles and morels,
Share your secrets if you want to harvest even more mushrooms.


Will you have the most delicious harvest?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Potion House
boardgame.description:
The witch is finally going on holiday and will hand over the potion house to her best apprentice.

Choose how many ingredients your potions will contain.
Search the attic and memorise where they are hidden.
Make your potions using the magic wand.


Keep an eye on what your opponents are doing to make the best potions as fast as possible!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Nightfell
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Nightfell is an original horror/fantasy setting.

This setting will guide you into a dark world full of terror and despair. The Undeads are coming back from the afterlife, and the Eternals are craving the nullification of reality.

You will face ancient horrors, superstition, and occultism.

You will learn to follow the Moon as your only guide in this nocturnal world.

In this ruthless setting, players will play night explorers: resilient survivors who adapted to the Lunar Age, an era where the sun is dead, and life still endure only thanks to the last Primordial beings.

boardgame.name: Copperhead County
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Copperhead County is a Southern noir game about organized crime and political corruption in a fictional slice of present-day Tennessee. Steal, deal, and pursue the American Dream in a place where whiskey and blood run together.

Copperhead County is Forged in the Dark, based on the beloved engine from Blades in the Dark and inspired by media like Breaking Bad, Better Call Saul, and The Wire, plus contemporary crime fiction.

boardgame.name: Contamination Europe
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Contamination Europe - A Post-Apocalyptic Role Playing Game

Contamination Europe is a classic-style Role Playing Game set in a post-apocalyptic future. If you have no more use for Elves, Dwarves or Heroes, you have come to the right place.

Brief Summary
In 2065 a worldwide nuclear war destroyed human civilization and killed nearly everyone and everything on Earth. The few who survived the war formed new factions and communities in the remnants of destroyed cities. As time passes, new species emerges, mutated by radiation. Eighty-nine years later the world is still a rotting graveyard, but a few survivors fight to see the next day.

Contamination Europe is set in 2154 in a post-apocalyptic Germany. Prior to the nuclear war, the Germans fought the Russian army in yearlong bloody trench warfare for the last coal deposits in Eastern Germany. Because of the general shortage of raw materials, hardly any motorized units were deployed. Whole armies of tanks and airplanes were useless. The war was an infantry war similar to the First World War. Eventually the Russian army used biological and chemical weapons to break through the frontlines, but this attempt failed. Still, the use of B and C weapons continued for some years. Even after the nuclear war, wide areas are still contaminated with deadly viruses and chemical gases. These regions are now known as the "Toxic Fields".

In the years after the bombs, several new factions rose. The Wasteland Tribes, the Bandit Clans, the Trade Union, the Panzer League and others had arisen from the nuclear ashes to pursue their own goals.

The player characters are wasteland dwellers who explore the deadly wasteland for equipment and food. Depending on their actions, they will earn or lose reputation to the various factions. They may play as the good guys or the bad guys.

Players can also find or buy their own home base and equip it with various facilities such as water filter, furniture, power plants, automated guns, minefields or a howitzer.

boardgame.name: Schnauferl-Rennen im Revier
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move their cars. They start at "Start". The first to reach "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published as "Das große Weinachts-Würfelspiel der WAZ" in the Christmas 1965 edition of the "Westdeutsche Allgemeine Zeitung".

—user summary

boardgame.name: Water Hack
Waterhack
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

WATERHACK is a post-apocalyptic roleplaying game set in the Waterless Wastes, inspired by OSR hacks, Jack Vance humor, and the struggle for water rights. Players create Accountants who wander around the Wastes trying to preserve water and keep struggling communities afloat. Of course, things are weird – really weird – and the heroes will find out that old baseball cards or potted plants are just as valuable as a good pistol.

boardgame.name: The High Magic Sourcebook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The High Magic Sourcebook introduces all-new mechanics for high magic, epic spells, circle magic, and spellsinging, to make the magic system for fifth edition Dungeons & Dragons more chaotic and powerful than ever before. Marshal unimaginable energy with cooperative spellcasting and feed an empire—or erase your enemies from existence.

New subclasses and a slew of new spells, magic items, downtime activities, and creatures support the high magic mechanics, making it a living, breathing part of the Forgotten Realms campaign setting. This book also offers guidelines for adapting these rules to Eberron, Strixhaven, and other D&D worlds.

boardgame.name: Die WAZ Flaschenpost
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move their bottles. They start at space 1 (Rheinhausen). The first to reach "Ziel" (Zeeland) wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The Game was publishes in the Christmas 1963 issue of the "Westdeutsche Allgemeine Zeitung (WAZ)"

—user summary

boardgame.name: それやっぱボクの！ (Sore Yappa Bokuno!)
boardgame.description:
それやっぱボクの！ (Sore Yappa Bokuno!) is a card game from Japan. Players are babies, squabbling over who gets the toys and baby bottles.

Each player has cards marked I Want! or I Don't Want!. Object cards are dealt up and players place their cards face-down on these. When the cards are turned up, the player with a lone I Want! collects the card. But if more than one has placed I Want! on an object, nobody gets it.

Players are trying to build up sets and score points to win the game.
user summary

boardgame.name: Risus: Pokémon
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Risus: Pokémon adapts the popular monster-collecting franchise to Risus.

boardgame.name: Pokeymanz Tabletop RPG
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Pokeymanz!

Are you a Girl? A Boy? Neither? Do you remember the name of my grandson?

This system is intended to be a lower-crunch, higher narrative emphasis alternative to many of the Pokémon RPGs currently bouncing around the internet space. I hope you enjoy this take, inspired mainly by the anime and the Pokémon Special manga, and taking many, many mechanics from games I like.

Many aspects of this game assume that the reader is already familiar with Pokémon and the Pokémon world, and has access to Bulbapedia, Serebii, or similar resources. For the sake of brevity, this is intentional. This is not intended to be a gateway into Pokémon, but an RPG for people who are already into Pokémon and want to play around in its world with loose, narrative rules and some wiggle room.

boardgame.name: Revier-Spiel
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start in Essen. The first to return to Essen wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published in the April 1985 issue of the "Westdeutsche Allgemeine Zeitung (WAZ).

—user summary

boardgame.name: Okol Invation
boardgame.description:
We get into the role of some aliens from the planet Multiplus called Okols.

The goal of the Okols is to recharge the energy of mother D10 by conquering all the planets in the universe.
All this will be achieved by playing two of our 10 cards and multiplying one of them with the power of the D10 and placing the result in one of the squares of the map of the planet to conquer.
In this game you will conquer the planet earth, a lava planet , submarine and many others.
You will practice your multiplication tables while having fun in this board game with area control mechanics, cards and dice.


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Anime 5E Pocket Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the myriad realms of imagination, there are many dungeons to explore, dragons to tame, and paths to find.

Anime 5E helps you unlock the realms of fantasy to experience them all.

Welcome to Anime 5E – the fantasy role-playing game for all your anime and manga adventures, which builds upon the Fifth Edition rules of “the world’s most popular storytelling game”. This stand-alone RPG pocket edition brings a point-based balance to the standard Fifth Edition offerings, and then layers a wide selection of new races, classes, skills, features, powers, game mechanics, and combat options on top of this foundation. Anime 5E is the beginning of a journey,
so hold on tight as we welcome you to your next great fantasy adventure!

The Anime 5E Pocket Edition is the ideal entry point into the game for backers who are looking for a smaller, portable book format at half the price of the standard full-colour edition. Presented in the familiar manga-sized dimensions, the Anime 5E Pocket Edition weighs in at a hefty 384 black-and-white pages. Most of the content from the regular hardcover edition is included in this alternate format – including all rules, races, and classes, and monsters – using a slightly smaller font size and fewer illustrations. Chapter 12 (plus two brief designer note appendicies) from the regular edition, which provides player and DM guidance, has been omitted to keep the page count (and thus cost) lower. Use the Anime 5E Pocket Edition solo as your primary game book, or as an additional inexpensive reference copy for your gaming table.
boardgame.rpgseries: Anime 5E: Fifth Edition Fantasy Role-Playing Adventures

boardgame.name: Anime 5E Game Screen and Adventure Expansion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Carry on Wayward Son is a multi-part introductory adventure for Anime 5E. The scenario is for 3-5 capable characters (2nd Level, or possibly 3rd Level) that unfolds over two to four sessions, each 2-4 hours in length.

The adventure encourages players to experience combat situations, as well as a number of political and social challenges. As DM, you will be expected to help the players transition between both styles of play. Player characters will likely advance at least one Level during the extended adventure – possibly during Part Two, but certainly during Part Three before the threat levels and frequency increase in Part Four.
boardgame.rpgseries: Anime 5E: Fifth Edition Fantasy Role-Playing Adventures

boardgame.name: Anime 5E Introductory Primer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the myriad realms of imagination, there are many dungeons to explore, dragons to tame, and paths to find.

Anime 5E helps you unlock the realms of fantasy to experience them all.

Welcome to Anime 5E – the fantasy role-playing game for all your anime and manga adventures, which builds upon the Fifth Edition rules of “the world’s most popular storytelling game”. This free fast-play rules primer is your introduction to Anime 5E’s character creation process and game system, and provides you with a brief overview of what to expect from an Anime 5E game.
boardgame.rpgseries: Anime 5E: Fifth Edition Fantasy Role-Playing Adventures

boardgame.name: Anime 5E Game Screen Adventure Pre-Gens
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anime 5E Game Screen Adventure Pre-Gens is an exclusive digital collection of six 2nd-Level characters that can be used on their own in any game, or as pre-generated options for the Carry on Wayward Son adventure included with the Anime 5E Game Screen.
boardgame.rpgseries: Anime 5E: Fifth Edition Fantasy Role-Playing Adventures

boardgame.name: Anime 5E Pre-Gen Character Pack
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anime 5E Pre-Gen Character Pack is an exclusive digital collection of 18 diverse NPCs and player characters that can be used in nearly any Anime 5E game: six 4th-Level, six 8th-Level, and six 12th-Level. Archfiend Magical Girl? Half-Dragon Pet Monster Trainer? Hill Dwarf Samurai? It's all in here!
boardgame.rpgseries: Anime 5E: Fifth Edition Fantasy Role-Playing Adventures

boardgame.name: Anime 5E Adventuring Accessories
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anime 5E Adventuring Accessories is an exclusive digital collection of 30 game stats and brief write-ups across the power spectrum: magical artefacts, fantasy mecha, intriguing poisons, dangerous traps, sleek vehicles, and powerful weapons.
boardgame.rpgseries: Anime 5E: Fifth Edition Fantasy Role-Playing Adventures

boardgame.name: Anime 5E Bonus Character Options
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anime 5E Bonus Character Options is an exclusive digital collection of two character races (Crogoblin and Loralai), two classes (Mindmancer and Simulake), and two organisations (Bounty Hunters' League and Grey Council).
boardgame.rpgseries: Anime 5E: Fifth Edition Fantasy Role-Playing Adventures

boardgame.name: Anime 5E Mounts & Monsters Bundle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anime 5E Mounts & Monsters is an exclusive digital collection of 15 game stats and brief write-ups across the power spectrum: conversion of traditional Fifth Edition monsters, original Anime 5E monsters, and character mounts.
boardgame.rpgseries: Anime 5E: Fifth Edition Fantasy Role-Playing Adventures

boardgame.name: Anime 5E 1st Level Introductory Adventure Scenario: Shades of Grey
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shades of Grey is a short action/dilemma scenario for Anime 5E. A terrible calamity has befallen a small community of Grey living in a remote forest. During a recent village celebration, the Grey feasted upon a common root vegetable that was unknowingly spoiled by a toxic fungus. Nearly everyone soon fell terribly ill from food poisoning, and the three unaffected Grey were sent on a mission to the closest city to find an herbalist to concoct a remedy. On the way back, things went bad.

This scenario is ideal for up to eight 1st-Level Anime 5E characters.
boardgame.rpgseries: Anime 5E: Fifth Edition Fantasy Role-Playing Adventures

boardgame.name: Anime 5E 4th Level Survival Adventure Scenario: Aggro Hell Hounds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Aggro Hell Hounds is a short survival and action scenario for Anime 5E. Perhaps stealing that gorgeous six-inch emerald from the sorcerer’s keep wasn't such a good idea. But a job was a job, and it paid well enough. But how were you to know that the consequences would be so dire? You have been running for days trying to escape that bloody hell hound pack to no avail. They are incredible trackers! You're tired and hungry, and earlier today you used up your last swiftrunning potions. Your horses died of exhaustion several days ago. When you spy a small military outpost in the clearing up ahead, you visit there to seek aid.

This scenario is ideal for up to six 4th-Level Anime 5E characters.
boardgame.rpgseries: Anime 5E: Fifth Edition Fantasy Role-Playing Adventures

boardgame.name: Handimonsters Annual 2022
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monsters! The first Handimonsters annual brings you a collection of 51 unique, 5e monsters to frighten challenge and delight your players.

Created across the year at Handimonsters, the annual collects the work of some of the most experienced 5e designers, artists, and graphic designers in one beautiful volume.

Meant for play! At Handimonsters we love monsters that work at the table. That means they have an interesting feature related to the rules and are designed to provide an interesting challenge: they're not just a list of stats and a bunch of HP. They all have engaging lore which gives them a place in your game world, and hooks to inspire you as GM and for your players to grab onto at the table. Every monster in this book comes with it’s own full page entry, and every one is illustrated. The annual includes a CR index for your convenience, and an introduction abotu our process for your interest.

Our lead designer at Handimonsters is Jacob Rodgers. Jacob has done tons of very highly-regarded work in the 5e space, from Adventures in Middle-earth, BEOWULF: Age of Heroes, Scarred Lands Creature Collection 5e, to Symbaroum 5e. Jacob really knows the 5e system inside out.

Our art is by Scott Purdy. Scott is likewise an industry veteran, and it would be quicker to list the companies Scott has not worked for. Scott's preferred subject is MONSTERS, and it's easy to see why. He's a brilliant artist.

Our layout and graphic design is by Paul Bourne. Paul is without doubt one of the most talented and meticulous layout artists in the business. Paul continues to delight both those well-versed in layout, and those who just enjoy a cool logo and an easy to read page.

Overseeing all of this is Jon Hodgson. Jon set up Handiwork Games in 2019, after decades of working in the industry.

Handimonsters brings you unique monsters every week, with a free monster each month! If you'd like 2 flavours of vtt token and printable standees for all of the monsters in this Annual, just sign up at the Handimonsters page and get instant access to the entire back catalogue!

boardgame.name: Crossing the Millers (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nobody knows anybody that well.

Finney the Miller, master of West Corners, wants the Fixer's crew to take care of a romantic rival he suspects has captured his mistress' eyes, if not her heart. But how is a rival gang—a gang that has sworn allegiance to the Millers--involved? Loyalties are betrayed and secrets are revealed as the West Corners slide into a war between gangs.

Crossing the Millers is a 45-page PDF adventure for Sword Noir: A Role-Playing Game of Hardboiled Sword & Sorcery (Second Edition) for two to six starting characters. The adventure includes six pre-generated characters. While the adventure does not require the use of Sword Noir, the narrative characters and mechanical challenges would require modification to use with another.

boardgame.name: The Sultan's Treasure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nearly 300 years ago, Nocturne played host to a visitor from a far-off land. The Sultan, his bodyguards, and his wives settled into a luxurious home in the heart of the city, until they were all murdered one moonless night. Though many sought to find it, the Sultan's treasure was never recovered...until now.

boardgame.name: Wilderness Dressing: Hills (2.0 - PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of glossing over the details of your characters’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add in minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives you--the busy GM--the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features, events and encounters. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, it is an invaluable addition to your GM's toolbox!

Wilderness Dressing: Hills presents:

Minor Events: One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your characters’ wilderness travel.
Minor Dressings: One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
Uneventful Day's Travel: One table (20 entries) presenting descriptions of uneventful days on the road.
Campsites: One table (20 entries) presenting campsites to add details to your characters' overnight wilderness trips.
Random Encounters: One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.

boardgame.name: Wilderness Dressing: Hills (2.0 - OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of glossing over the details of your characters’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add in minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives you--the busy GM--the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features, events and encounters. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, it is an invaluable addition to your GM's toolbox!

Wilderness Dressing: Hills presents:

Minor Events: One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your characters’ wilderness travel.
Minor Dressings: One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
Uneventful Day's Travel: One table (20 entries) presenting descriptions of uneventful days on the road.
Campsites: One table (20 entries) presenting campsites to add details to your characters' overnight wilderness trips.
Random Encounters: One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.

boardgame.name: Wilderness Dressing: Hills (2.0 - 5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of glossing over the details of your characters’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add in minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives you--the busy GM--the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features, events and encounters. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, it is an invaluable addition to your GM's toolbox!

Wilderness Dressing: Hills presents:

Minor Events: One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your characters’ wilderness travel.
Minor Dressings: One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
Uneventful Day's Travel: One table (20 entries) presenting descriptions of uneventful days on the road.
Campsites: One table (20 entries) presenting campsites to add details to your characters' overnight wilderness trips.
Random Encounters: One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.

boardgame.name: Grotesque: Gargoyle Lineage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From inanimate stone to enspirited life, a grotesque is free from the patient servitude of their gargoyle kin. They bear the marks of their creation, however.

boardgame.name: The Torn God
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A MONSTER OF THE WEEK MYSTERY!

BottleBlast is an annual 3-day music, wine, food, and brew festival that attracts over 100,000 visitors to Napa, California, looking for cleverly marketed wine and beer, live music performances by the hippest bands in the western hemisphere, beautiful people, and opportunities to drop buckets of cash.

EAT THE RICH!

But this year’s fun and profits have been tainted by a gruesome attack that left a popular social-media influencer and two of her friends dismembered and partly eaten. The attack threatens to expose Zappa’s political and business elites who, for generations, have ensured bountiful harvests, beauty, and profitable financial portfolios by sacrificing their fellow Californians to Dionysus Aesymnetes, ancient Greek god of wine and madness.

MURDER! MAYHEM! CANNIBALISTIC CULTS! OVERPRICED WINE!

boardgame.name: Attack of the Cartoon Kaiju!!!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A MONSTER OF THE WEEK MYSTERY!

Karl Cheating is a billionaire financier and founder of Solid Citizens for Decency, an anti-pornography organization noted for its harassment of queer artists, convenience-store owners, and the poor. In addition to crushing the hopes and dreams of working people, Cheating’s other passions are kaiju movies and Queen’s Island, an amusement park owned by his hated rival, Dottie Kennedy Raft.

A LITERAL ROLLERCOASTER!

Cheating has concocted a perfect way to satisfy all his passions at the same time. Several years ago, Crosswick Ventures, one of his many compaies, captured the legendary Crosswick Monster, a giant humanoid amphibian. Dr. Ellen MacNamara, co-founder of CV, synthesized a mutagen from the creature that enables humans to temporarily grow 100 feet tall. Recognizing an opportunity to fulfill his kaiju fantasies, punish his rival, literally crush the hopes and dreams of working people, and make a lot of money, Cheating invented a unique recreational opportunity for his fellow billionaire nihilists.

ALL YOUR FAVORITE 150-FOOT-TALL, MURDEROUS CARTOON CHARACTERS!

Fragglepuss, Gogo Bear, Schmurfette, and Huckleberry Ape are ready to rampage! Will your Hunters discover the mystery behind the Attack of the Cartoon Kaiju?

boardgame.name: Fiona Fantasia & Her Fabulous Furry Friends
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A MONSTER OF THE WEEK MYSTERY!

Gruesome murders and sudden disappearances have left towns across the upper Midwest terrified, confused, and desperate for answers. Unknown to them, the source of the violence is Fiona Fantasia & Her Fabulous Furry Friends, a traveling carnival featuring thrill rides, games of skill and chance, and an elaborately choreographed show featuring dancers dressed in brightly colored cartoon animal costumes. But Fiona’s Friends aren’t just dancers, and those costumes aren’t costumes . . .

BEWARE THE RITUAL OF FURIOUS FURRYDOM!

boardgame.name: Speed Demon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A MONSTER OF THE WEEK MYSTERY!

Filippo Marinetti is Team Principal for Fuerte Racing, a Z1 race team with great ambitions and an unerring eye for emotionally unstable drivers, suboptimal vehicle design, and the bottom third of team rankings. Desperate for success, Marinetti has embraced a less . . . scientific approach.

DRIVE TO SURVIVE!

Take your Hunters from the Texas Lonestar Circuit to a Badlands cult compound roaring with classic 1960s muscle cars to the most glamorous race of them all, the Monaco Z1 Grand Prix! Murder, mayhem, social-media influencers, a baby Cthulhu in a swimming pool, a remarkably fast armadillo, and all the high-performance automobiles you could ever desire!

boardgame.name: The Mystery of the Mystery Flesh Pit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A MONSTER OF THE WEEK MYSTERY!

The organism known to scientists as the Permian Basin Superorganism was accidentally discovered in 1973 by employees of Anodyne Deep Earth Mining, though the indigenous Caddo people had long told tales of a great dragon that slept, dreaming, beneath the earth . . .

The land around the orifice leading into that unfathomably massive creature was declared a national park in 1980. The Mystery Flesh Pit brought hundreds of thousands of tourists and millions of black-budget biotech research dollars to nearby Gumption, Texas. Notwithstanding the earthquakes, the visions of pullulating flesh that plagued the sleep of children, and the occasional extraordinary rendition of "humanoid compound surface fauna," life in Gumption was happy.

COME FOR THE BROKEN PHILOSOPHY, STAY FOR THE AMNIOTIC LATTES!

However, on July 5, 2007, disaster struck. Torrential rain, a cascading series of poor management decisions, and an ill-timed fireworks display caused a "premature geobiological consumption event," resulting in hundreds of fatalities and thousands of physical and psychological injuries. The park was closed. Anodyne was found grossly negligent, forced into bankruptcy, and reorganized into the Permian Basin Recovery and Superorganism Containment Corporation, tasked with overseeing damage payouts and administering the sedatives necessary to prevent the PBS from reawakening.

But where there is profit, there is a way. After years of intensive lobbying by the Gumption Chamber of Commerce and a series of classified U.S. Senate briefings by the PBRSCC's management, the park has reopened. But neither Gumption nor the park are the same as they used to be. Something weirder than the usual weirdness is in the air: Operation Clown Car, a mass-scale mind-control experiment exploiting the eldritch powers of the PBS. Claire Luna, CEO of the PBRSCC, is in charge of that operation; however, long-term exposure to psychogeographical radiation and far too many venti-size amniotic lattes has transformed her into a minion of the PBS—and the tens of thousands of visitors visiting Mystery Flesh Pitapalooza! into the main dish of a cataclysmic feast!

VERDANT FORESTS, MAJESTIC SCENERY, AND COSMIC TERROR!

boardgame.name: Skin Deep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Skin Deep, the heroes defend the lands of humanity against the machinations of extra-dimensional doppelgangers known as sand dwellers. The sand dwellers corrupt susceptible mortals, hollowing out their bodies and stealing their skins to take their places. They have infiltrated human governments and militaries and are undermining them, weakening them against the invasion by their warlord-queen, Ravazel the Butcher.

Can the heroes unravel their schemes and help humanity stand fast against this otherworldly menace, or will they too be hollowed out and replaced?

boardgame.name: They Came From Beyond the Grave!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

I urge you now: do not open this book. Do not read its contents. Walk away, live your simple life, and keep these creatures of darkness in the shadows where they belong.

Opening your eyes to this horrible world – where demons possess dolls, the undead stalk the night, the Devil walks among us, and mummies march from their tombs – is an act of incredible bravery, or perhaps, complete foolishness. Turn away now, before it’s too late…

No? Well, in that case, welcome to a little game called They Came from Beyond the Grave!

They Came from Beyond the Grave! is a dramatic, hammy, and horrifying tabletop roleplaying game encompassing the shock, terror, eroticism, and humor of 1970s horror. This game allows you to play with all the magnificent content from the movies of Hammer, Amicus, and Roger Corman, and promises the fun and thrills of the horror movie genre!

In They Came from Beyond the Grave!, you play humans faced with the horrors of the supernatural. You’ll find yourself pitted against vampires, werewolves, ghosts, and constructed critters, along with demons, slashers, and THE DEVIL HIMSELF. Adventures range from the one-shot exploration of a haunted house, to the multi-era play across the 19th century and 1970s.

They Came from Beyond the Grave! contains a mix of serious threat, unmitigated ham, and nonsensical farce. We never tell you what is amusing and what is not, but we do provide the tools to make a seriously fun game incorporating all the elements of 1970s horror movies. This game provides rules for funny quips and amusing cinematics for incorporation in a story, along with dozens of special powers and story devices.

They Came from Beyond the Grave! uses the Storypath System, provided in full in the pages of this book!

They Came from Beyond the Grave! includes:

Five playable Archetypes — the Dupe, the Hunter, the Mystic, the Professor, and the Raconteur.
Rules for character creation and play, using the Storypath System fully detailed in this book.
Cinematic powers, such as the ability to tear through cheap sets, cut to black when everything is looking grim, and even cut to a montage to speed up play.
Quips to throw in at entertaining moments, giving your characters a chance at an award-winning scene, or at least one that makes it into the trailer.
Scores of monsters looking to hunt you down and make your lives miserable, from Dracula to Frankenstein’s Monster.
Two ready-to-play scenarios, playable straight from the book.
boardgame.rpg: They Came from Beyond the Grave!

boardgame.name: The Dark Quarter
boardgame.description:
Welcome to New Orleans, Louisiana, circa 1980: a vibrant city of music, food, and magic. Neon lights flicker in dirty puddles up and down Bourbon street; the innovations of the modern world clash with ancient and terrible traditions; and murder is never simple. The Beaumont Agency, staffed with a roster of brilliant, colorful, and ultimately ﬂawed private investigators, specializes in solving cases that no one else can crack.

In The Dark Quarter, a co-operative app-driven adventure game set in a dark, fantastical vision of 1980s New Orleans, players each take control of a Beaumont agent and work alongside one another to solve the worst crimes that New Orleans has to offer. It's a world full of magic, where hexing curses are sold on every street, where voodoo priestesses and creatures of the night are lurking around every corner, and where even the most mundane crimes have a tinge of the supernatural to them.

Through multi-scenario campaigns, the game tells a rich, dynamic story and invites players to make critical decisions that will not only affect their characters, but change the direction and course of the story. The characters are not simply avatars, easily replaceable from scenario to scenario; instead, they are woven into the very fabric of the story itself. Their destiny and the destiny of New Orleans are inextricably linked together.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Dark Quarter: Deluxe Metal Experience Tokens
The Dark Quarter: Deluxe Plastic Tokens
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Dark Quarter: Lost to the Night
The Dark Quarter: The Yesterday Demon & Other Stories
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 87: Llama Land, Founders of Teotihuacan, Meadow, The Dark Quarter, Kohaku - Top 5 Games That Begin With ”M”

listing.notes:
New PREORDER the whole damn agency pledge
Final sale

boardgame.name: Totenstadt: Angriff der Killer-Kürbisse Booster
boardgame.description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

The Totenstadt is criss-crossed by a network of pumpkin tendrils, pumpkin fields clog the streets and a crazy professor is about to create a huge monster pumpkin!

The cards can simply be mixed up with the city of the dead basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters!

—description from the designer

Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!

Die Totenstadt wird wird von einem Netz von Kürbisranken durchzogen, Kürbisfelder verstopfen die Straßen und ein verrückter Professor will einen gewaltigen Monster Kürbis erschaffen!

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!

—description from the designer (German)

boardgame.name: Dream a Tree
boardgame.description:
Help the squirrels to build the tree of their dreams by using all branches. A game where helping is the key to win!

The goal is to use the most tiles possible to build the biggest most beautiful tree. Start the game by placing the two "owl" tiles on the playing surface, making sure you leave enough room to grow your tree in all directions. New tiles must match all adjacent sides with the existing tiles. The game is over when you can no longer add a tile because there is no legal placement or there are no more tiles. The prize is admiring your creation.

boardgame.name: Operation Neptune
boardgame.description:
The British assault on the river Seine in August 1944.

This historical ASL (HASL) module includes:

10 scenarios plus a campaign game
1 25"x25" map
90 1/2" counters
32 5/8" counters
Rules
Chapter Divider card.


This is not a complete game. Ownership of the following products are required to play all of the included scenarios:

BFP: Either of the following: Poland in Flames or Onslaught to Orsha 2 (2 counters needed)
MMP/Hasbro/AH: Beyond Valor, For King and Country (or West of Alamein)

3 of the scenarios need boards from other MMP products.
ON 1-7 use the HASL map
ON-8 uses boards 81 and 83 from Forgotten War
ON-9 uses boards 1b and 4b from Action Pack 6 & Action Pack 8
ON-10 uses board 7a from Action Pack 9
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: ASL Action Pack #6: A Decade of War
ASL Action Pack #8: Roads Through Rome
ASL Action Pack #9: To the Bridge !
For King and Country: ASL module 5a
