boardgame.name: Way of the Most Delightful Way
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A new DnD 5e subclass for Monks! Keep a careful eye on your party, intercede when you need to, and lay out punishment for those who dare harm your charges.

boardgame.name: Final Girl: Into the Void
boardgame.description:
Final Girl Feature Film Box

Deep space. You and the rest of the crew of the USCSS PATNA find yourself in deep sh... er ... space when you notice something scurries across the floor and into the ventilation shaft. Can you destroy it before it morphs into something much bigger and much deadlier? Or will the Evolmorph harvest the bodies of the entire crew?

It’s kill or be killed in when you’re being hunted in space! The Evolmorph (pronounced "Evil-morph") will evolve over the course of the game and features a “vanishing” mechanic where it will disappear into the ventilation shafts only to return when you least expect it… or perhaps if you plan it right, into a well-laid ambush!

The USCSS PATNA spaceship introduces ‘keycards’ that can be used to access different parts of the ship. Will you kill your foe the old-fashioned way? Self-destruct the ship and escape? Or perhaps you’ll try to airlock the killer into the void!

The Core Box, when combined with one of our Feature Film Boxes, has everything you need to play the game. Each Feature Film Box features a unique Killer and and iconic Location, and the more Feature Films you have, the more killer/location combinations you can experience!

Each Feature Film Box is double-sided, with amazingly illustrated covers on the front AND back. Not only that, but the magnetically attached box covers are removable, with the reverse of each functioning as the Killer and Location boards respectively.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q4 2022*** Contents: Kickstarter Edition of Final Girl: Into The Void Board Game Expansion by Van Ryder Games. Includes expansion. Requires Final Girl: Core Game to play (sold separately). Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: Final Girl: Terror at Station 2891
boardgame.description:
Final Girl Feature Film Box

There's nowhere to run when an unseen enemy comes to the arctic station where you and a small project group have come to do research. The only way out is by helicopter, but the problem is, you don't know who you can trust. Who has been assimilated by the organism? Someone? Everyone?

You won’t know who you can trust when playing against The Organism. How can you fight what you can’t see? You’ll have to test the victims in the lab or with test kits you find to determine if they’ve been assimilated. Of course, your real job is to kill mutated victims to stop the spread once identified! Featuring three different types of organisms, you’ll never know what you are going to face.

The arctic Station 2891 features new unique challenges. Anyone who stays outside too long risks succumbing to frostbite, but the only escape is via the helicopter traveling to and from the station from the Arctic airport. Will you try to save your comrades against all odds, or look out for numero uno and use them to buy yourself time?

The Core Box, when combined with one of our Feature Film Boxes, has everything you need to play the game. Each Feature Film Box features a unique Killer and and iconic Location, and the more Feature Films you have, the more killer/location combinations you can experience!

Each Feature Film Box is double-sided, with amazingly illustrated covers on the front AND back. Not only that, but the magnetically attached box covers are removable, with the reverse of each functioning as the Killer and Location boards respectively.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q4 2022*** Contents: Kickstarter Edition of Final Girl: Terror At Station 2891 Board Game Expansion by Van Ryder Games. Includes expansion. Requires Final Girl: Core Game to play (sold separately). Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: Final Girl: A Knock at the Door
boardgame.description:
Final Girl Feature Film Box

Nothing like a reunion at the quiet and secluded Wingard Cottage. Everyone is having a great time. The booze is flowing and the party has begun. Then comes a knock at the door. A quick glance around the room tells you everyone who's supposed to be here already is... You approach the door and slowly open it, peeking around the edge of the door. No one is there. But someone was... the question is, who?

What horror game would be complete without a home invasion? The Intruders are here. Face not one, not two, but THREE killers. You thought one was hard, but you’re really going to have to stay on your toes against these murderous menaces.

Wingard Cottage offers a new challenge with unique events and a new crafting mechanism that lets you take ordinary items and turn them into epic weapons. Stick with that knife or scrounge up some wood and nails to craft The Obliterator? It will be up to you, just make the call before it is too late!

The Core Box, when combined with one of our Feature Film Boxes, has everything you need to play the game. Each Feature Film Box features a unique Killer and and iconic Location, and the more Feature Films you have, the more killer/location combinations you can experience!

Each Feature Film Box is double-sided, with amazingly illustrated covers on the front AND back. Not only that, but the magnetically attached box covers are removable, with the reverse of each functioning as the Killer and Location boards respectively.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q4 2022*** Contents: Kickstarter Edition of Final Girl: A Knock At The Door Board Game Expansion by Van Ryder Games. Includes expansion. Requires Final Girl: Core Game to play (sold separately). Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: Final Girl: Once Upon a Full Moon
boardgame.description:
Final Girl Feature Film Box

Over the river and through the woods to grandmother's house you go. Never mind the growling, it must be your imagination, just keep skipping and singing. You stop in your tracks as a big, bad wolf leaps onto the path in front of you. Its eyes glow red and drool drips from its fangs as it stands on the path between you and your destination... Grandma will have to wait.

Not every story ends happily ever after. This isn’t the Big, Bad, Wolf you imagined as a child. It’s bigger and badder than you could imagine. Can you slow the wolf down before it becomes fast enough to move anywhere on the board in a single turn? Featuring “hunt” and “slay” modes, the killer will take different actions depending on what mode it is in, making for yet another unique challenge for you to tackle!

Storybook Woods features a unique layout with a river running through the land. You’ll have to cross rickety bridges only you and one victim can safely traverse. Fairy tale events and items may be a magical miracle or a crippling curse. Will you get lost, or make it out of the woods alive?

The Core Box, when combined with one of our Feature Film Boxes, has everything you need to play the game. Each Feature Film Box features a unique Killer and and iconic Location, and the more Feature Films you have, the more killer/location combinations you can experience!

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q4 2022*** Contents: Kickstarter Edition of Final Girl: Once Upon A Full Moon Board Game Expansion by Van Ryder Games. Includes expansion. Requires Final Girl: Core Game to play (sold separately). Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: Final Girl: Madness in the Dark
boardgame.description:
Final Girl Feature Film Box

No matter where you go in Wolfe Asylum, noises and voices always seem to echo. It is particularly frightening when one of the residents cackles or a group of them cheer during a game of them cheer during a game of bingo in the common room. Those noises are nothing, however, compared to the blood-curdling shrieks of terror generated by the evil brand of medical "care" the Rachet Lady is giving the asylum's residents and staff. What do you do when the maniacs come?

The Ratchet Lady is in a mood. She’s performing her own brand of therapy on the victims, turning them into bloodthirsty maniacs. You’ll have to decide if you want to try to calm them down or kill them before they can kill you. But the only way to really stop them will be to put down the Ratchet Lady herself.

Wolfe Asylum seems harmless and like a typical mental institution to outsiders. Inside lies something very different. There’s medicine and other drugs inside that can, shall we say, amplify your abilities. But at what cost? When the choice is death or a potential side effect, it really isn’t a choice at all. Down the hatch!

Each Feature Film Box is double-sided, with amazingly illustrated covers on the front AND back. Not only that, but the magnetically attached box covers are removable, with the reverse of each functioning as the Killer and Location boards respectively.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q4 2022*** Contents: Kickstarter Edition of Final Girl: Madness In The Dark Board Game Expansion by Van Ryder Games. Includes expansion. Requires Final Girl: Core Game to play (sold separately). Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: What Cause The Big Whoopsie?
boardgame.description:
A catastrophic event known as 'The Big Whoopsie' has wiped out most of the humans across the planet. "Oh heck!" I hear you say.

All that is left to do for the survivors is to pin the blame on someone... obviously.

As a head of one of these organisations, you must piece together the remnants of the world and discover if it was a Nuclear no no, a WOAH! Winter, a nasty Nature or if it was Aliens!... Ahhhh!

...and find out once and for all, what caused the Big Whoopsie.

What Caused The Big Whoopsie is a 2-4 player game involving drafting, secret objectives, secret bidding and tile matching with transparent plastic cards, all around the glorious apocalypse!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Silvis
boardgame.description:
The Silvis Woods are home to many small Critter vying to survive, and the constant threat of the expanding presence of the Predators of the Lobus and Vulporo families brings greater threats.

Take an ever growing family of Critters and explore the diverse Silvis Woods all the while avoiding Predators and attempting to save as many of your family as you can from the evil Dens and deliver to the great Usates. Usates can only truly rescue one family, and they must have enough Sustenance to be saved. Which unique family will make it?

In Silvis up to 4 Players will be racing against one another, and the distinctive Predator threat by laying new Forest tiles, playing Cards that can completely alter the state of the board and can cause some ruthless combinations.

All whilst trying to balance how many Critters to keep in the Woods, each one you save nets you a point, but each one you keep gives you more action points each turn. A game of cute Critters and idyllic forest backdrops with a very large dose of player interaction for those evil enough.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hy-Yah!
boardgame.description:
Hy-Yah! is a card based physical duel where each card may have two different attacks, for tens of thousands of possible outcomes. Draft different decks to simulate fatigue and strategise on how to bluff and beat your opponent into submission.

A simple and quick 2 player rock-paper-scissors style card game that fits into a tin, where after drafting each deck at the start of the game players take their hands and simultaneously reveal a two sided cards. These cards range from jabs and uppercuts, to flying kicks and meditation, each one being a counter for another type of ability.

Choosing not only which card, but which side of the card to play is the key to whittling down your opponents health and winning the most rounds.

boardgame.name: Niespokojna Toń
boardgame.description: 40-page brochure Quick Start for CoC 7th ed, created as a cross-promo material with the Polish edition of Unfathomable board game premiere. Contains a Deep Ones-related adventure.

boardgame.name: Dwie z Tysiąca
boardgame.description:
A Masks of Nyarlathotep spin-off campaign "Two out of a Thousand", written specifically for the Polish audience.

From the publisher's blurb:

Udaj się do Egiptu, aby uczestniczyć w polskiej wyprawie archeologicznej!
Udaj się w pełną niebezpieczeństw podróż do Egiptu, aby uczestniczyć w polskiej wyprawie archeologicznej mającej na celu zbadanie ruin starożytnej świątyni. Poczuj smak orientu podczas odkrywania potworności z przeszłości, które obce wywiady chcą wykorzystać do swych niecnych celów.

Pięć scenariuszy w tym podręczniku stanowi zamkniętą kampanię pośród egipskich piasków i zagadek. Jednak znajdziesz tam też wskazówki, jak poprowadzić te scenariusze w formie pojedynczych przygód oraz w stylu pulpowym.

Dodatkowo znajdziesz tutaj alternatywny prolog do kampanii Masek Nyarlathotepa, który pozwala włączyć polskich Badaczy do tej przygody! Ten scenariusz będzie również świetnym materiałem na przygodę niezwiązaną z Maskami.

Poszukiwania zaginionego dziennika peruwiańskiej wyprawy prowadzą do odkrycia przerażającej prawdy. Prowadzone przez Badaczy śledztwo dostarcza odpowiedzi na pytanie dlaczego zgromadzone w muzeum eksponaty kolekcji Władysława Klugera budzą zainteresowanie tajemniczych naukowców i mrocznych kultystów z całego świata.

Kampania Maski Nyarlathotepa nie jest wymagana do rozegrania scenariuszy z tego podręcznika.

boardgame.name: PANDEMIA
boardgame.description:
PANDEMIA is a competitive strategy game for 2 to 6 players.

In this game a very contagious virus has been detected in different regions of the world and is spreading fast.

At the beginning of the game, players are given several regions that they must protect in exchange of points.
To do so, players will manage different resources that will allow then to undertake different actions along the game such as develop vaccines, build walls to block the virus or get special cards that will help them during the game.

Players can also influence which new regions the virus might infect each turn. This is finally decided with a roll-a-die mechanic meaning that luck is also somehow involved.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ikaros
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A tabletop roleplaying game where sacrifice is the only way forward, Ikaros gives each player a huge amount of control over whether to turn a failure into a victory... for a price. Rerolls and bonus dice hurt, and characters don't always have a lot of hurt they can take. When the only thing between you and a violent death is your guts, how much of your future are you willing to sell?

boardgame.name: Once Upon a Crime
boardgame.description:
Not long ago, in Happily-ever-after Village , the situation had become extremely complicated, corruption and crime taken over what was a dream city. Laureate storytellers wandered looking for different tricks to survive in this savage world. The city was in deep chaos, every night a new crime took place, a complicated job even for the most suspicious. Are you aiming to solve them?

In the game, the players must be divided by teams. One of the first team became the Forensic and will do a story with one card of each category on the table. The players, by teams, will try to solve the Forensic case. At the beginning, the Forensic will provide the name of the case, the victim’s name and the time of death.

Starts with the Forensic rival team, the teams will try to solve the case making inquiries about the possible killers, weapons, crime scene and motive. The Forensic will determine how many mistakes have been made in each of the attempts and will reveal different pieces of evidence that can clarify the event.

After several attempts, one of the teams will have solved the case. The winning team will be the one that reaches 12 Points.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Fire Temple Monsters
Valeria: Königreich der Karten – Erweiterungspack #13: Feuertempel-Monster
boardgame.description:
Contains:

Hell Wasp
Sigbin
Gagambah
Lava Elemental
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Darksworn: Kickstarter Edition

boardgame.name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Kaharian Monsters
Valeria: Königreich der Karten – Erweiterungspack #12: Kaharische Monster
boardgame.description:
Contains:

Kaharian Hatchlings
Kaharian Hunt Mage
Kaharian Brute
Kaharian Kill Master
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Darksworn: Kickstarter Edition

boardgame.name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Shade Events
Valeria: Königreich der Karten – Erweiterungspack #11: Schattenmonster-Ereignisse
boardgame.description: The 9 Shaded Monsters from Darksworn as Event Cards for Valeria: Card Kingdoms.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Darksworn: Kickstarter Edition

boardgame.name: Amulet of Thrayax
boardgame.description:
Amulet of Thrayax is a competitive, card-driven area control board game for 2 - 6 players, designed by Tom Truman and published by Trolls ’n’ Rerolls.

You are eccentric cults, rampaging through the dystopian fantasy city of Bleakpyre, harvesting the souls of decadent nobles and selfish peasants with every outrageous tool at your disposal.

Battling to win the powerful Amulet of Thrayax, you use a combination of Murder and Counter cards to reap souls - AKA points - from the city.

To claim the amulet, you'll need to bring all your most devious tactics to the party:


Spend souls to swoop from District to District
Tip the scales with a variety of corrupt, monstrous and messy "Inconveniences"
Hijack your opponent's best-laid plans to feed your own soul engine
Manipulate the Amulet’s power to unleash the biggest and baddest combos on your unsuspecting rivals


When the final bell chimes, the winner is the cult that has beaten and hoodwinked the most souls out of Bleakpyre.

If you’re looking for a fun, accessible game that also provides a layer of tactical challenge for seasoned gamers, then we think you’ll love killing time with Amulet of Thrayax.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Erune: Miniature Set – Set de figurines
boardgame.description:
This set adds new monsters not in the core box. It contains
2 Rats
2 Skeletons
2 Skeleton Archers
2 Living Armors
2 Goblins
2 Goblin Archers
2 Goblin Riders
2 Orcs
1 Troll
2 Gargoyles
2 Evil Dogs
1 Fiens
1 Witch

boardgame.name: Erune: Furniture Set
Erune: Set de fournitures
boardgame.description:
This set contains
3 Barrels
2 Cupboards
3 Tables
4 Chests

boardgame.name: Kantin Wars
boardgame.description:
A card game for people who love playing with their food, or throwing them at other people.

From the co-creator of The Cikgu Life, comes a game inspired about a real food fight that broke out in a school canteen. Kantin Wars will remind you of the food you enjoyed back in school, while also allowing you to sabo the people around you.

Players draw food cards which they can throw at each other, until the Discipline Teacher shows up and punishes them all! Play different cards that help you throw better, dodge flying food, hide away or even wash up to ensure you stay clean during the fight!

boardgame.name: Familiar Faces Issue 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Familiar Faces Issue 1 is a free 16pg e-zine that compiles 3 detailed NPCs and a bunch of adventure seeds.

Ainsley Blackwood: Xenotech Restorator
Kurt Pharaoh: Travelling Artifact Curator (newly into Space Horror Remnant Exhibitions)
Marcello Renato: Numismatist (historical coin collector)


NPCs TO FIT IN ANY UNIVERSE: NPCs in this book are supposed to have interesting professions that are necessary for any future world. There will be wealth that obsesses over found artifacts across the universe and there will be adventurers who come across ancient xenotech they have no idea how to use. Therefore, there must be specialists who provide services to solve these issues.

These characters are designed to work independent of their setting and plopped into any other space station or planet. Please use a single sentence or the entire book for your home games.

THE SEEDS: This is a passion project inspired by Chris McDowell’s work on Electric Bastionland and Sean McCoy’s + TKG’s work in the Mothership modules. Both provide subtle settings. They bake in assumptions and favor lore + flavor over canon. This is what Familiar Faces aspires to do.
The seeds are scattered in the NPCs' acquaintances and motivations. Many of these seeds won’t be watered in-house during future issues, but we hope there ends up being hundreds of versions of the Laughing Sphinx Corporation, Uruk 1, and Eudaimonia

boardgame.name: Alien Armory
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alien Armory is a collection of bio-punk weapons, armors and equipment compatible with the Mothership Sci-Fi Horror RPG.

The Second Earth Xenobiology Committee has analyzed and catalogued a series of dangerous items of alien origins. Equip your Mothership characters with these horrendous tools or use them as plot hooks for deep space adventures.

This book contains:

22 Bio-punk items
Void Septopus: Living vehicle
4 Xenodealer NPCs
Bio-punk items generator
